column4: Important question, I noticed that ubuntu 8.04 doesnt detect HD in my new MB, while 8.10 does. I believe that the cause is sata drivers/raid
how i can integrate does drivers? if that were the problem.
right if is ahci they are running sata not IDE. 8.10 detect them without problem . 8.04 doesnt show partitions.
why not php5?
because some code written for php4 doesn't work for php5
found some reference for you: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=796515
take a look there.
problem with that is that php4-cgi isn't in any repositories
so it won't help me one bit
sorry man but php4 has been completely replaced with php5 . SO they remove it from repos.
you will have to compile it.
http://www.php.net/downloads.php
why do they do this.. i understand that they want people to use php5 and mysql5 and all that, but why not just leave the packages there and let people install it using a force option or something
maybe you may try php5 and try resolving issues. Its the best for you
it's not my code
and it's HUGE
are you sure it wont work?
it "works".. but i have a couple of errors and the developers won't touch it since we're running it on php5, since they say that it is only guaranteed to work on php4
Support for PHP 4 has been discontinued since 2007-12-31. Please consider upgrading to PHP 5.2."
well thats a bad practice. THey should try upgrade it to php5.
install apache from repos. then compile php 4.
